questions.question: What is the primary purpose of image preprocessing in computer vision?

options.A: To make images look more aesthetically pleasing
options.B: To enhance image quality and prepare it for further analysis
options.D: To convert images to black and white only

questions.explanation: Image preprocessing is crucial for improving image quality by reducing noise, normalizing brightness, enhancing contrast, and preparing the image for subsequent analysis tasks.

questions.question: What is feature extraction in computer vision?

options.A: Converting images to different file formats
options.B: Identifying and extracting meaningful patterns and characteristics from images

questions.explanation: Feature extraction involves identifying and isolating distinctive characteristics in images that are useful for classification, detection, or other computer vision tasks.

questions.question: What is semantic segmentation in computer vision?

options.B: Assigning each pixel to a specific object class or category

questions.explanation: Semantic segmentation involves classifying each pixel in an image into predefined categories, creating a pixel-wise understanding of scene content.

questions.question: What role does deep learning play in modern computer vision?

options.A: It's only used for image storage
options.B: It enables automatic learning of hierarchical features and complex visual patterns
options.C: It's only used for image compression
options.D: It's only used for image display

questions.explanation: Deep learning has revolutionized computer vision by automatically learning hierarchical features from data, enabling more accurate and robust visual recognition systems.

questions.question: What is transfer learning in computer vision?

options.B: Using pre-trained models as a starting point for new tasks

questions.explanation: Transfer learning involves using models pre-trained on large datasets as a starting point for new tasks, saving time and improving performance on limited data.

questions.question: What is optical flow in computer vision?

options.B: The pattern of apparent motion between consecutive frames in a video

questions.explanation: Optical flow tracks the motion of objects between consecutive video frames, essential for motion analysis and video understanding.

questions.question: What is the purpose of data augmentation in computer vision?

options.B: To increase training data variety by applying transformations

questions.explanation: Data augmentation involves creating modified versions of training images to increase dataset size and variety, improving model generalization.

questions.question: What is instance segmentation in computer vision?

options.A: Counting total objects in an image
options.B: Detecting and separately segmenting each instance of objects, even of the same class

questions.explanation: Instance segmentation combines object detection and segmentation to identify and segment individual object instances, even of the same class.

questions.question: What is the role of attention mechanisms in computer vision?

options.B: To help models focus on relevant parts of the image

questions.explanation: Attention mechanisms help models focus on relevant image regions, improving performance in tasks like object detection and image captioning.

questions.question: What is few-shot learning in computer vision?

options.B: Learning to recognize objects from very few training examples

questions.explanation: Few-shot learning enables models to learn from very few examples, making them more practical for real-world applications with limited data.

questions.question: What is the purpose of image pyramids in computer vision?

options.B: To analyze images at multiple scales

questions.explanation: Image pyramids create multi-scale representations of images, enabling analysis of objects at different sizes and distances.

questions.question: What is the role of regularization in computer vision models?

options.B: To prevent overfitting and improve generalization

questions.explanation: Regularization techniques help prevent overfitting in computer vision models, ensuring better generalization to new, unseen data.

questions.question: What is the purpose of non-maximum suppression in object detection?

options.B: To eliminate redundant detection boxes for the same object

questions.explanation: Non-maximum suppression removes overlapping bounding boxes, keeping only the most confident detection for each object.

questions.question: What is the role of anchor boxes in object detection?

options.B: To provide predefined box shapes and sizes for detection

questions.explanation: Anchor boxes are predefined box templates that help detection models predict object locations and dimensions more effectively.

questions.question: What is the purpose of image registration in computer vision?

options.A: To catalog images in a database
options.B: To align multiple images of the same scene or object

questions.explanation: Image registration aligns multiple images of the same scene taken from different viewpoints or times, essential for medical imaging and panorama creation.

questions.question: What is the role of depth estimation in computer vision?

options.B: To predict the distance of objects from the camera

questions.explanation: Depth estimation predicts the distance of objects from the camera, crucial for 3D scene understanding and autonomous navigation.

questions.question: What is the purpose of image stitching in computer vision?

options.B: To combine multiple images into a panorama

questions.explanation: Image stitching combines multiple overlapping images to create panoramic views, useful in photography and virtual tours.

questions.question: What is the role of pose estimation in computer vision?

options.B: To determine the position and orientation of objects or people

questions.explanation: Pose estimation determines the position and orientation of objects or human bodies, essential for augmented reality and human-computer interaction.

questions.question: What is zero-shot learning in computer vision?

options.B: Recognizing objects without any training examples

questions.explanation: Zero-shot learning enables models to recognize new object categories without any training examples, using semantic relationships between classes.

questions.question: What is the purpose of image denoising in computer vision?

options.B: To remove unwanted noise and artifacts from images

questions.explanation: Image denoising removes unwanted noise and artifacts from images, improving quality for both visual appearance and subsequent analysis tasks.
